definition: amnesty/general pardon
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to pardon (a convict)
Amnesty International/same as 大赦國際
Amnesty International

sentences.english: According to the act of grace many prisoners will be set free.
sentences.chinese: 按照大赦令，很多囚犯获得释放。

sentences.english: The officials freed under the amnesty have been restored to their posts.
sentences.chinese: 大赦中获释的原官员们已官复原职。

sentences.english: The officials freed under amnesty have been returned to their posts.
sentences.chinese: 大赦中获释的原官员们已官复原职。

sentences.english: A generous amnesty succeeded in preventing any further bloodshed among Athenians.
sentences.chinese: 随后施行了慷慨的大赦，防止更多的雅典人流血。

sentences.english: An immigration amnesty has enabled many illegal residents in the U.
sentences.chinese: 移民大赦使得部分非法在美居留的人得以重见天日。

sentences.english: But Thursday, Amnesty International issued a statement, decrying the court's decision.
sentences.chinese: 但周四，大赦国际发表的一份声明，谴责法庭的判决。

sentences.english: The new emperor declared a total amnesty.
Amnesty International released its report in London last week.
sentences.chinese: 大赦国际上周在伦敦发布了这项报告。

sentences.english: The king decreed a general amnesty.

definition: amnesty/pardon
decree to grant a special pardon
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
hurriedly/in haste
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to take to one's heels/to scram
overjoyed at unexpected good news (idiom)
to pardon (a convict)
to break into a run
in a great rush/in a flurry
in a panic/flurried
to accept an order
